intro: Chenopodium twisselmannii, commonly known as the Tussilago chenopod, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its upright growth habit and small, greenish flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and have a slightly hairy texture. Chenopodium twisselmannii is often found in desert scrub and grassland habitats.
